title: Holiday Money Diaries: How little can a millennial spend on a family holiday to Center Parcs?
text:
Welcome to the eighth instalment of Holiday Money Diaries, a series in which travellers reveal every penny they spent while away. This week: a family trip to Center Parcs, Longleat. The total spent is at the bottom.

This is a slightly warped edition of Holiday Money Diaries in that I was essentially a freeloading guest of my mother. Since my two brothers and I have flown the nest the Morris clan has established a rough tradition of a biennial family holiday to ensure we still remember what our relatives look like; I make this trip to Center Parcs the third.

Previously we’ve rented a villa for a week in Majorca, but now my older brother has a second child, something more practical and a little closer to home was needed and so we set off to Longleat for a long weekend.
